meaning: A set of instructions to complete a task or solve a problem
The process of dividing a problem into smaller, more manageable sub-problems - these sub-problems are then divided further and so on.
The process of removing unnecessary details from a problem to focus on the important parts
A notation resembling a programming language, used to describe the steps in an algorithm or the logic flow of an algorithm
A type of diagram using arrows and boxes, which allows the programmer to visualise an algorithm before it is turned into code.
The data that is sent to a program to be processed
The process of taking the input, applying an algorithm to it, and then outputting the result
Anything that is sent out of a program
The amount of time and/or resources required to complete a task
An algorithm that locates a specific item in a list of items
An algorithm that sorts a list of items into a specific order
A searching algorithm that searches through a list of items one at a time, until the item is found
A searching algorithm that searches through a list of items by splitting the list in half and comparing the item to be found to the item in the middle of the list
A sorting algorithm that compares two items at a time and swaps them if they are in the wrong order
A sorting algorithm that splits a list of items into two halves and then sorts each one separately, then merges the two sorted lists back together
